About.description: is a global, members-based platform established in 2015 in response to a G20 request. Neutral and unbranded, it serves as a hub for policy-makers, practitioners, and researchers working on social protection to collaborate, exchange experiences, stay informed, access resources, and strengthen capacities, with a particular focus on low- and middle-income countries.

OurFeatures.title: Why become a member of socialprotection.org?
OurFeatures.description: Becoming a member of socialprotection.org is free and gives you access to a smarter, more connected experience tailored to your interests. Here’s what you’ll gain:
OurFeatures.aiPoweredChatBotDescription: Get instant, relevant answers from our publications database with the Social Protection Assistant for Research and Knowledge Sharing (SPARKS).
OurFeatures.doSmartSearchesDescription: Find the content you need through our upgraded AI-powered Smart Search, designed to help you explore platform resources with precision.
OurFeatures.enjoyAPersonalizedExperienceDescription: Choose topics that interest you and benefit from a tailored journey. Access your own space to view your favorites, content you’ve authored or added, and much more!
OurFeatures.stayInformedDescription: Receive regular updates on resources related to the topics that matter most to you.
OurFeatures.shareYourContentDescription: Submit publications, events, opportunities and more to reach a global audience of professionals.
OurFeatures.joinOnlineCommunitiesDescription: Engage in thematic communities, join discussions, and collaborate with peers around the world.
OurFeatures.connectWithProfessionalsDescription: Expand your network by interacting with thousands of social protection professionals, from policy-makers to researchers.
OurFeatures.createYourOwnProfileDescription: Showcase your work, interests, and contributions through a dedicated member profile.

Ambassadors.title: Title
Ambassadors.ambassadorProgrammeDescription:
The Ambassadors Programme is an online volunteer programme developed by socialprotection.org with the goal to:

1. Ensure up-to-date and relevant content on the platform concerning the Ambassadors’ regional or thematic interests;
2. To promote engagement with socialprotection.org's activities and features; and 
3. To increase visibility of socialprotection.org within the Ambassadors' region and/or network

The Programme is operated through the United Nations Online Volunteering  website. Currently, the Programme has one edition per year, gathering people from all around the world to participate in varied tasks, such as blog writing, communications, content mapping, social media engagement, webinars, online communities and others.

Over the years, the Programme has already had 300 volunteers from almost 100 different countries. To learn more about the Ambassadors Programme, please see our Annual Reports. Calls for applications and Ambassador’s activities are disseminated on our social media channels and our newsletter.

We appreciate the efforts of our Ambassadors and hope they continue to be champions of socialprotection.org:

PrivacyPolicy.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPolicy.introductionParagraph1: At socialprotection.org, we are committed to respecting and protecting your privacy.
PrivacyPolicy.introductionParagraph2: socialprotection.org is the data controller of this platform. socialprotection.org believes strongly in protecting your privacy and the confidentiality of your personal information. We acknowledge that you may have privacy and security concerns with respect to the information we collect, use, and disclose to third parties for the purposes of allowing us to offer and provide our platform, products and services to you.
PrivacyPolicy.introductionParagraph3: This Privacy Policy sets out how we will process your personal data. It also explains the types of cookies we use on our website. By continuing to use our website, you consent to the use of those cookies.
PrivacyPolicy.introductionParagraph4: Please read this policy carefully to understand how we collect, use and store your personal data, and do not hesitate to contact us in case you have any doubts.
PrivacyPolicy.generalParagraph1: This Privacy Policy (the Policy) applies to socialprotection.org, administered by the International Policy Centre for Inclusive Growth (IPC-IG) by the socialprotection.org team.
PrivacyPolicy.generalParagraph2: socialprotection.org is a member-based platform that aims to facilitate knowledge sharing and capacity building on effective social protection policies and programmes. It is a platform by which you can freely access a comprehensive database and multimedia learning materials on social protection, while simultaneously fostering a community of social protection practitioners. You do not need to register as a member of the platform to have access to content. Membership is required to participate in online communities or e-learning activities.
PrivacyPolicy.generalParagraph3: socialprotection.org includes automated features that use artificial intelligence, such as Sparks (a conversational assistant) and the Knowledge Management Assistant (KMA). These features process only publications and other publicly available platform content to provide informational summaries and recommendations. They do not process, store, or analyze personal user data, messages, or identifiable information. All AI activities are conducted in compliance with this Privacy Policy.
PrivacyPolicy.collectionParagraph1: socialprotection.org processes personal information only to fulfil its legitimate interest of connecting people interested in social protection and knowledge sharing. To receive our newsletter and information on our webinars, you need to provide us with personal information, such as your name and e-mail address. Such information will not be shared with third parties, nor be used for corporate/propaganda/commercial purposes, nor published for general access.
PrivacyPolicy.collectionParagraph1_1: You do not need to be a member of the platform to receive the monthly newsletters or webinar communications.
PrivacyPolicy.collectionParagraph2: socialprotection.org is a member-based platform that aims to connect people interested in social protection. Therefore, to access certain features of the platform, users are required to create a member account and provide personal information such as their name, e-mail address, language of preference, and affiliated institution. Member account information will not be shared with third parties, nor be used for corporate/propaganda/commercial purposes, nor published for general access.
PrivacyPolicy.collectionParagraph3: By creating a member account, your name is visible and searchable for platform users. Any additional profile information is made visible at the members discretion, by ticking profile display preferences on their member account. All data, regardless of being mandatory information for registration on the website or not, are considered equal for the purposes of this privacy policy.
PrivacyPolicy.collectionParagraph4: By accessing the platform, certain information about you, such as Internet Protocol (IP) addresses, navigation through the Site, the software used and the time spent, will be stored by web analytic servers. This information will not identify the member/visitor specifically. The information will be for internal use only, including but not limited to the analysis of website traffic, and may include information obtained from cookies. You can turn off the use of cookies at any time by changing your specific browser settings.
PrivacyPolicy.collectionParagraph5: The socialprotection.org team will use the identifying information for statistical and communication purposes, including but not limited to the distribution of newsletters and other materials for which you expressed interest in when registering. These may include information about socialprotection.org's activities and promotion of other platforms, products, and services. We may access, preserve and disclose information that you provide to:
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem1: facilitate effective access to the socialprotection.org platform and the learning products hosted on the platform;
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem2: carry out our obligations arising from any contracts entered into by you and us;
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem3: seek your views or comments on the services we provide;
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem4: To the extent required by law, legal process, the Charter of the United Nations, resolutions or regulations of the General Assembly;
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem5: To enforce the Terms of Use or this Privacy Policy;
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem6: To respond to third party claims;
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem7: To protect the rights, property or personal safety of socialprotection.org personnel, Members and Visitors.
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem8: See the areas of the website you visit
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem9: See the amount of time you spend on the site
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem10: See whether you are new to the site, or have visited it before
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem11: See how you came to our website – for example, through an email link or a search engine
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem12: See the type of device and browser you use.
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem13: notify you of changes to our services; and
PrivacyPolicy.collectionListItem14: send you communications which you have requested and that may be of interest to you.
PrivacyPolicy.collectionParagraph6: In addition, automated features such as Sparks and the Knowledge Management Assistant (KMA) may analyze the text of publications, articles, or other publicly shared content to generate insights or assist users in finding related materials. These processes do not include the analysis of user accounts, personal information, or private communications. No data processed by these systems is used for AI model training, user profiling, or external data sharing.
PrivacyPolicy.coursesParagraph1: If you express interest in, or register for, a course, or e-learning activity, we will record details related to that activity, including whether you started and/or completed it, the scores you achieve in assessments, certificates you earn, your responses to evaluation and feedback surveys, and other information relating to your participation in learning. We will use this information for the management and provision of courses.
PrivacyPolicy.coursesParagraph2: If you register on the socialprotection.org e-learning platform, your profile information will be visible to all other users through the messaging system and any in-course discussions. Only those who are taking the same courses as you will be able to see any additional personal details.
PrivacyPolicy.coursesParagraph3: If you access an online course through socialprotection.org that was created by a third-party provider, we will share data with that provider in anonymised, aggregated form (e.g. the total number of people who started and/or completed the course over a given time). This anonymised, aggregated data may include aggregate information about the gender, age or location of the people who start and/or complete the course.
PrivacyPolicy.coursesParagraph4: If you join an instructor-led training (e.g. face-to-face or webinar) given by a third-party organisation, you agree we can provide the third-party organisation with basic personal information so that they can provide that course (which may require them to contact you), as well as any additional data you provide when you join that course.
PrivacyPolicy.coursesParagraph5: As part of a course given by a third-party provider, you may be asked to provide personal information about yourself. If you provide that information, you agree that we can provide that information to the third-party provider to provide the course.
PrivacyPolicy.coursesParagraph6: If you join a course that is administered by a third-party, they will be able to access your personal information and may also be able to access your learning history, as part of the standard reporting provided on who has accessed a course and the progress they have made in it.
PrivacyPolicy.coursesParagraph7: If you join socialprotection.org through a third-party organisation's own branded login page, they will be able to access your personal information and learning history.
PrivacyPolicy.coursesParagraph8: Please note that some third-party providers are based in countries outside of the European Union whose laws may not provide the same level of data protection.
PrivacyPolicy.coursesParagraph9: Along with the information you provide when registering, you will have the opportunity to provide additional data such as interests, profile picture, or additional contact details through your profile. Contributions made through the site, including comments on chat sessions or discussion forums, are shared by you willingly, spontaneously and consensually, and may be stored on the site and visible by other users.
PrivacyPolicy.coursesParagraph10: The information you submit is available in countries outside of the European Union whose laws may not provide the same level of data protection.
PrivacyPolicy.deletingParagraph1: You can modify your information on the platform by logging in to your member account or by contacting the socialprotection.org team.
PrivacyPolicy.deletingParagraph2: If you wish to request deletion of any publication or content you have contributed that may have been processed by Sparks or KMA, you can contact the socialprotection.org team. Upon deletion of such content, it will no longer be available for automated processing on the platform.
PrivacyPolicy.deletingParagraph3: To unsubscribe from our monthly newsletter, click on the unsubscribe link at the bottom of the newsletter or contact our team.
PrivacyPolicy.deletingParagraph4: To deactivate your account at any time, contact our team at contact@socialprotection.org
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesIntro: In this policy, we use the term "cookies" to refer to browser cookies and other similar technologies covered by the European Union Directive on privacy in electronic communications.
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesWhatContent: A cookie is data that a website requests your browser to store on your computer or mobile device. The cookie allows the website to "remember" your actions or preferences over time. Most Internet browsers accept cookies. However, users can set their browsers to refuse certain types of cookies or specific cookies. In addition, users can delete cookies at any time.
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesWhyContent: We use cookies to learn how you interact with our content and to improve your experience when you visit our platform. For example, some cookies remember your language or preferences so that you don't have to make these choices repeatedly every time you visit one of our pages. We also use cookies to store authentication information. We may use what we learn about your behavior on our website to improve our platform.
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesTypesTitle: What types of Cookies do we use?
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesFirstPartyContent: We use both first-party cookies and third-party cookies on our website.
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesFirstPartyContent_1: First-party cookies are cookies issued by the socialprotection.org domain and are generally used to identify language preferences, authentication, or facilitate basic site functionality.
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesThirdPartyContent: Third-party cookies are owned and managed by other companies, such as statistical collection and analysis tools. These cookies are necessary for our access tracking and reporting purposes to our partners, no personal data is shared in this process.
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesSessionContent: Session cookies are temporary cookies that are used to remember you during the course of your visit to the platform, and they are deleted when you close your session.
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesPersistentContent: Persistent cookies are used to remember your website preferences and remain on your desktop or mobile device even after you close your browser or perform a reset. We use these cookies to analyze user behavior and establish patterns so that we can improve the functionality of our website for you and other visitors.
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesThirdPartyUseContent: For some of the functions within our websites we use third-party vendors, for example, when you visit a page with a video embedded or sourced from YouTube. These videos or links (and any other content from third party vendors) may contain third party cookies, and we recommend that you consult the privacy policies of these third parties on their websites for information regarding their use.
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesRejectTitle: How do I reject or delete Cookies?
PrivacyPolicy.cookiesRejectContent: You can choose to reject or block all or specific types of cookies set on your visit to the platform by clicking on the cookie preferences on our website. You can modify your preferences by changing your browser settings. If you have already confirmed the use of cookies and want to delete them, you will have to actively change or block cookies in your browser settings. Please note that most browsers automatically allow the use of cookies. If you reject the use of cookies, you can still visit our website, but some features may not function properly. You can also visit www.allaboutcookies.org for more details on how to delete or reject cookies and for information in general. Some AI-related features may rely on cookies or similar technologies to maintain session continuity or personalize content suggestions. These cookies do not track personal information and can be managed using the same cookie preferences and browser settings described above.
PrivacyPolicy.cookiePosthogDesc: We use Posthog to understand how you interact with our website in order to improve the user experience.
PrivacyPolicy.cookieGoogleAnalyticsDesc: We use Google Analytics to understand how you interact with our website in order to improve the user experience.
PrivacyPolicy.cookieCloudflareDesc: We use Cloudflare to monitor for suspicious traffic and avoid downtime problems. This cookie is necessary for the operation of the application.
PrivacyPolicy.cookieAuthDesc: We use authentication cookies to determine session length, enhance security standards and provide ease of access in case the user selects the "Remember me" feature when authenticating

SensitiveData.title: Sensitive Data Capture Policy
SensitiveData.introductionParagraph1: This document explains the rationale and legal basis under which the Social Protection Platform collects, stores, and processes personal and sensitive data in accordance with the European Union General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
SensitiveData.introductionParagraph2: It supplements our Privacy Policy and provides transparency on why and how each category of potentially sensitive information is handled within the platform's backend systems.
SensitiveData.purposeParagraph1: All personal data collected through the platform serves a defined and legitimate purpose directly related to user account management, platform functionality, or community engagement.
SensitiveData.purposeParagraph2: The lawful bases for processing, as defined under Article 6(1) of the GDPR, include:
SensitiveData.purposeListItem1Content: — when users actively provide optional data such as gender identity, language, or interests.
SensitiveData.purposeListItem2Content: — for processing necessary to provide user accounts, authentication, and core platform services.
SensitiveData.purposeListItem3Content: — for compliance with data protection and security requirements.
SensitiveData.purposeListItem4Content: — for improving platform performance, personalization, and fraud prevention, balanced against user rights and expectations.
SensitiveData.purposeParagraph3: For special category data as defined in Article 9(1) (e.g., gender, biometric data inferred from profile pictures), processing occurs only under explicit user consent (Art. 9(2)(a)) and solely for limited, non-discriminatory purposes such as personalization and community display.
SensitiveData.rationaleGenderContent: Collected to tailor content recommendations and support diversity analytics. Optional and user-controlled. Stored as text only.
SensitiveData.rationaleProfilePicturesContent: Used solely for profile display, author attribution, and community recognition. Users may update or remove at any time.
SensitiveData.rationaleSocialAccountContent: Imported only when users choose to authenticate via Google or LinkedIn. OAuth data may contain incidental sensitive attributes (e.g., location, picture). Processing is limited to authentication and profile setup.
SensitiveData.rationaleLocationParagraph1: Used for regional content filtering, event scheduling, and localization.
SensitiveData.rationaleLocationListItem1: Country and city fields personalize content and facilitate networking among practitioners from similar regions.
SensitiveData.rationaleLocationListItem2: Time zone supports correct scheduling of webinars and notifications.
SensitiveData.rationaleLocationListItem3: Interest-based country data refines recommendation algorithms.
SensitiveData.rationaleIdentifyingParagraph1: Names, email addresses, and UUIDs are essential for account identification, communication, and authorship attribution.
SensitiveData.rationaleIdentifyingParagraph2: All identifiers are stored securely and never shared publicly without user action (e.g., publication authorship).
SensitiveData.rationaleProfessionalContent: Professional affiliation, institution type, and role enable content attribution and community networking. Employment status and professional title are optional, user-editable fields that enhance discoverability in professional contexts.
SensitiveData.rationaleLanguageParagraph1: Language preferences enable multilingual support and localized content delivery.
SensitiveData.rationaleLanguageParagraph2: While language data may imply cultural background, it is used strictly for UI and content localization.
SensitiveData.rationaleInterestsContent: Interest topics, communication preferences, and subscription settings are collected to tailor content and communications. Users may modify or revoke these preferences at any time via their profile settings.
SensitiveData.rationaleBehavioralContent: Engagement metrics (likes, comments, favorites, search history) are processed to improve content discovery and analytics. All such processing is pseudonymized, used in aggregate, and never employed for profiling beyond platform functionality.
SensitiveData.rationaleAuthenticationParagraph1: Passwords are stored using secure one-way hashing.
SensitiveData.rationaleAuthenticationParagraph2: OAuth and multi-provider authentication fields ensure seamless access control without exposing raw credentials.
SensitiveData.rationaleAuthenticationParagraph3: Legacy password fields exist only for transitional compatibility.
SensitiveData.rationaleUserGeneratedContent: Chat messages, comments, and survey responses are collected for user support, research, and engagement features. Survey data may contain sensitive insights but is always processed under explicit consent for each survey.
SensitiveData.rationaleAccountStatusContent: Status flags and timestamps ensure proper account lifecycle management, including onboarding, deactivation, and deletion workflows.
SensitiveData.rationaleMembershipContent: Institutional membership data governs access control and supports visibility within communities. Only roles necessary for platform governance are stored.
SensitiveData.rationaleNotificationsContent: Notification settings and schedules enable users to control communication frequency and delivery channels. These preferences are stored separately to ensure privacy-compliant email and in-app messaging.
SensitiveData.minimizationParagraph1: Where possible, the platform limits data collection to the minimum required for service delivery.
SensitiveData.minimizationParagraph2: Most personal and sensitive fields are optional (null=True, blank=True), ensuring users can participate without disclosing non-essential data.
SensitiveData.minimizationParagraph3: Sensitive categories (e.g., gender, professional title) are used only when explicitly provided by the user.
SensitiveData.retentionParagraph1: Personal data is retained only as long as necessary for the purposes described:
SensitiveData.retentionListItem1Content: Data retained for ongoing service provision.
SensitiveData.retentionListItem3Content: Accounts marked for deletion are automatically purged after 30 days.
SensitiveData.retentionListItem4Content: Content contributions (e.g., comments or publications) may be retained in anonymized form for archival or research value.
SensitiveData.thirdPartyParagraph1: When users authenticate through Google or LinkedIn, limited personal information is shared via OAuth.
SensitiveData.thirdPartyParagraph2: The Social Protection Platform acts as the data controller for imported information and processes it solely for authentication and profile creation.
SensitiveData.thirdPartyParagraph3: The OAuth providers remain controllers of their respective data systems.
SensitiveData.automatedParagraph1: The platform employs automated processing for:
SensitiveData.automatedListItem3: Social graph analysis for connection suggestions
SensitiveData.automatedParagraph2: No automated decision-making produces legal or significant effects on users under Article 22 GDPR. All algorithms are designed for informational and personalization purposes only.
SensitiveData.userRightsParagraph1: Users may exercise their data rights at any time by contacting contact@socialprotection.org:
SensitiveData.userRightsListItem1: Access and obtain a copy of their data (data portability)
SensitiveData.testVaiOuNaoVaiP: Request deletion or restriction of processing
SensitiveData.userRightsParagraph2: All requests are reviewed and processed in accordance with GDPR timelines and authentication safeguards.
SensitiveData.securityParagraph1: All personal data is stored in secure environments (PostgreSQL, S3/LocalStack) with access restricted to authorized administrators.
SensitiveData.securityParagraph2: Data transmission occurs over encrypted channels (HTTPS/TLS).
SensitiveData.securityParagraph3: Regular audits, role-based permissions, and encryption ensure confidentiality and integrity.
SensitiveData.contactParagraph1: If you have questions about this rationale or data processing practices, contact our DPO at:

Help.faqVolunteerQuestion: How can I volunteer or do an internship at socialprotection.org?
Help.faqVolunteerAnswer3: website takes a year. These programmes include activities to support socialprotection.org.
Help.faqVolunteerAnswer4: Our platform is hosted by the International Policy Centre for Inclusive Growth (IPC-IG) in Brasilia, Brazil, therefore internships are offered through the IPC-IG.
Help.faqVolunteerAnswer7: Our platform is hosted by the International Policy Centre for Inclusive Growth (IPC-IG) in Brasilia, Brazil, therefore internships are offered through the IPC-IG.
Help.faqSocialProtectionAnswer1: There is no single definition of social protection. Countries and organisations use the term social protection in different ways. For the International Policy Centre for Inclusive Growth (IPC-IG), for example:
Help.faqSocialProtectionAnswer2: [...] social protection would be composed of a set of actions financed by the State that would:
Help.faqSocialProtectionAnswer3: a) support individuals and families to have resilience to respond to crises and shocks, including social environmental risks
Help.faqSocialProtectionAnswer4: b) help especially the poor and vulnerable groups to have resilience to respond to crises and shocks, including social environmental risks,
Help.faqSocialProtectionAnswer5: and d) stimulate social inclusion and support families, particularly the most vulnerable to poverty, in building up and keeping their human and social capital through smoothing of income and consumption and ensuring their access to basic goods and services, and d) guarantee that everyone benefits from the fruits of growth and that development of capabilities, skills, rights and opportunities for the poor, marginalised and excluded groups, as well as low income workers from the formal sector in order to guarantee that everyone benefits from inclusive growth and progressive realisation of rights.
Help.faqSocialProtectionSource: Source: Lal, R., & Soares, F. V. (2012). Global social innovations in social protection: The Perspective of the World Review.
Help.faqSocialProtectionSourceLink: The Perspective of the World Review, 4 (2): 37-58.
Help.faqSocialProtectionGlossary: You can find this and many other definitions by different organisations on our
Help.faqSocialprotectionOrgAnswer1: socialprotection.org is an open member-based knowledge sharing and capacity building platform that is open to social protection professionals, academics and students. Thanks to the contributions of its members, collaboration with stakeholders, and the dedication of the socialprotection.org team, the umbrella platform directs access to a variety of features, including searchable databases of social protection publications and links.
Help.faqSocialprotectionOrgAnswer2: The platform provides free access to a variety of features, including searchable databases of social protection publications and links, which include useful, timely, news, events and programme profiles. Members of socialprotection.org can also be able to connect in the social space and join online communities dedicated to different themes. The platform also offers members to share social protection themed content, simply by uploading it to the platform.
Help.tessy: Social protection theory is put into practice on all its forms everywhere, via the implementation of universal, national social protection policies and programmes, with the ambition of contributing to inclusive growth and sustainable development.
Help.faqSocialprotectionOrgAnswer4: To know more about our work, please visit our About Us section.
Help.faqOrganizationSupportQuestion: I represent an organisation. How can socialprotection.org support our work?
Help.faqOrganizationSupportAnswer1: socialprotection.org is always looking for new collaboration and partnership opportunities and can support your organisation in many ways:
Help.faqOrganizationSupportAnswer2: facilitating knowledge sharing and capacity building activities i.e. webinars, online courses, livestreams, online communities, knowledge fairs;
Help.faqOrganizationSupportAnswer3: disseminating content and activities through our social media and communication channels to our specialised audience, connecting people and organisations working on social protection.
Help.faqOrganizationSupportAnswer5: or here. We will be happy to talk to you!
